"Teaching music to the students of Todd in any and every capacity is one of the greatest joys of my life. I am so grateful to the cast of SEUSSICAL: KIDS for their dedication, laughter and talent. I love all of their quirks, creativity, and wild imaginations. During musical rehearsals, they consistently reminded me that a person‚Äôs a person no matter how small, and that their voice always needs to be heard. I just love that these incredible students are able to share their voices with me, each and every day at Todd, and I can‚Äôt wait to see them soon! Brava to all!‚Äù said Ms. Stufkosky.

This past Wednesday, BMS art classes and BHS ceramics students participated in #Global Day of Clay! The special day, hosted by the National Council on Education in the Ceramic Arts and the ceramics department at the 92nd Street Y in NYC, celebrates the art of ceramics in its myriad applications around the world.

During middle school art classes, sixth graders created ‚Äúfolded animals,‚Äù seventh graders made quirky bird cups and eighth graders fabricated a clay garden. High school ceramics students created Chia Pets and pinch pots.

‚ÄúThe goal of Day of Clay is to create interest around ceramics and pull people from within and outside of the field into a deeper awareness regarding the role the medium plays in our lives,‚Äù said art teacher Jessica Dubin. ‚ÄúIn addition to being fun, using clay is a great way to build skills in 3-D problem solving and promotes fine motor coordination.‚Äù

During middle school art classes, sixth graders created ‚Äúfolded animals,‚Äù seventh graders made quirky bird cups and eighth graders fabricated a clay garden. High school ceramics students created Chia Pets and pinch pots.

‚ÄúThe goal of Day of Clay is to create interest around ceramics and pull people from within and outside of the field into a deeper awareness regarding the role the medium plays in our lives,‚Äù said art teacher Jessica Dubin. ‚ÄúIn addition to being fun, using clay is a great way to build skills in 3-D problem solving and promotes fine motor coordination.‚Äù
